subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Russia scored three power-play goals to beat the United States, 4-1, in the second round of the world championship in Bern, Switzerland. The United States scored first but committed too many penalties as Russia rallied for a 3-1 lead at the end of the first period. Russia got another power-play goal early in the second, and the Americans never looked close to a comeback in the teams’ first meeting at the championship in five years.
